data.title: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Visitor Center (Seattle)
data.meta_description: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Visitor Center is a museum in Seattle. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, also known as B&MGF or Gates Foundation, is a private foundation established by Bill Gates and Melinda Gates. It is headquartered in the city of Seattle, Washington. The foundation was initially created as the William H. Gates Foundation in 1994 and was later renamed as the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in 1999.

Leadership of the Foundation

The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation is led by a team of prominent individuals. The leadership includes Bill Gates, Melinda Gates, and Warren Buffett. Additionally, the foundation is co-directed by Bill Gates' father, William H. Gates Sr., and Jeff Raikes.

Philanthropic Activities

The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has been actively involved in various philanthropic activities around the world. Some of its notable initiatives include a $200 million campaign to promote AIDS prevention in India and a generous donation of $500 million for the global fight against AIDS. These initiatives reflect the foundation's commitment to addressing global health issues.
